  • Method Details

    • getGameInfo

      ConnectionState getGameInfo()
      Retrieves the current state of the game.

    • createGame

      int createGame(String nickname, int numPlayers) throws GameFullException, NicknameInvalidException, NicknameAlreadyInUseException, NumberPlayerWrongException, GameAlreadyCreatedException
      Creates a new game with the specified nickname and number of players.

      This method initializes a new game session using the provided nickname and number of players. It validates the inputs and may throw exceptions if the conditions are not met.

      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player creating the game. It must be a valid, unique nickname.
      numPlayers - the number of players in the game. It must be a positive number within the allowed range.
      Throws:
      GameFullException - if the game cannot accommodate more players.
      NicknameInvalidException - if the provided nickname is invalid.
      NicknameAlreadyInUseException - if the provided nickname is already in use.
      NumberPlayerWrongException - if the number of players is outside the allowed range.
      GameAlreadyCreatedException

    • connect

      boolean connect(String nickname) throws GameFullException, NicknameInvalidException, NicknameAlreadyInUseException
      Connects a player to the game using the specified nickname.

      This method attempts to connect a player to the game session using the provided nickname. It validates the nickname and ensures that the game can accommodate the new player. If the conditions are not met, appropriate exceptions are thrown.

      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player attempting to connect. It must be a valid, unique nickname.
      Returns:
      true if the connection is successful, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      GameFullException - if the game cannot accommodate more players.
      NicknameInvalidException - if the provided nickname is invalid.
      NicknameAlreadyInUseException - if the provided nickname is already in use.

    • reconnect

      boolean reconnect(String nickname) throws GameFullException, NicknameInvalidException, NicknameAlreadyInUseException, GameAlreadyCreatedException
      Reconnects a player to the game using the specified nickname.

      This method attempts to reconnect a player to the game session using the provided nickname. Or to load a previous game session after a fail of the server. It validates the nickname and ensures that the game can accommodate the player. If the conditions are not met, appropriate exceptions are thrown.

      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player attempting to reconnect. It must be a valid, unique nickname.
      Returns:
      true if the reconnection is successful, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      GameFullException - if the game cannot accommodate more players.
      NicknameInvalidException - if the provided nickname is invalid, or it was not in the previous game.
      NicknameAlreadyInUseException - if the provided nickname is already in use.
      GameAlreadyCreatedException

    • getAvailablePositions

      Set<Position> getAvailablePositions(String p) throws WrongTurnException
      Retrieves the available positions for the player.

      This method returns a set of positions where the specified player can place a card. It validates whether it is the correct turn for the player and may throw an exception if it is not the player's turn.

      Parameters:
      p - the identifier or nickname of the player whose available positions are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      a set of positions representing the available positions for the player.
      Throws:
      WrongTurnException - if it is not the specified player's turn.

    • place

      boolean place(String p, Face face, Position pos) throws RequirementsNotMetException, WrongTurnException
      Places a card for the specified player on the given position on the specified face.

      This method attempts to place a card for the player identified by the given nickname at the specified position with the specified face orientation. It checks if the requirements for placing the card are met and whether it is the player's turn. Appropriate exceptions are thrown if the conditions are not satisfied.

      Parameters:
      p - the nickname of the player placing the card.
      face - the face orientation of the card to be placed.
      pos - the position where the card is to be placed.
      Returns:
      true if the card is successfully placed, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      RequirementsNotMetException - if the requirements for placing the piece are not met.
      WrongTurnException - if it is not the specified player's turn.

    • chooseColor

      List<GoalCard> chooseColor(String p, PlayersColor color) throws WrongTurnException
      Allows the specified player to choose a color.

      This method lets the player identified by the given nickname choose a color. It checks if it is the player's turn and may throw an exception if it is not the player's turn. The method returns a list of goalCards from which the player one in the next turn.

      Parameters:
      p - the nickname of the player choosing the color.
      color - chosen by the player.
      Returns:
      a list of goalCards.
      Throws:
      WrongTurnException - if it is not the specified player's turn.

    • chooseGoal

      void chooseGoal(String p, GoalCard goal) throws WrongTurnException
      Allows the specified player to choose a goal card.

      This method lets the player identified by the given nickname choose his personal goal. It checks if it is the player's turn and may throw an exception if it is not the player's turn.

      Parameters:
      p - the nickname of the player choosing the goal card.
      goal - the GoalCard chosen by the player.
      Throws:
      WrongTurnException - if it is not the specified player's turn.

    • pick

      void pick(String p, PlayableCard card) throws WrongTurnException
      Allows the specified player to pick a playable card.

      This method lets the player identified by the given nickname pick a playable card. It checks if it is the player's turn and may throw an exception if it is not the player's turn.

      Parameters:
      p - the nickname of the player picking the card.
      card - the PlayableCard chosen by the player.
      Throws:
      WrongTurnException - if it is not the specified player's turn.

    • getWinner

      List<Player> getWinner() throws WrongTurnException
      Retrieves the list of players who have won the game.

      This method returns a list of players who are considered winners based on the game's winning conditions. It checks if the method is called at the appropriate game state and may throw an exception if it is called at the wrong turn.

      Returns:
      a list of Players representing the winners of the game.
      Throws:
      WrongTurnException - if the method is called at the wrong turn or game state.

    • placeStarting

      List<PlayersColor> placeStarting(String p, Face face) throws WrongTurnException
      Places the starting card for the specified player on the specified face.

      This method attempts to place the starting card for the player identified by the given nickname with the specified face orientation. It validates whether it is the correct turn for the player and may throw an exception if it is not the player's turn. The method returns a list of PlayerColor from which the player one in the next turn.

      Parameters:
      p - the nickname of the player placing the card.
      face - the face orientation of the card to be placed.
      Returns:
      a list of PlayerColor.
      Throws:
      WrongTurnException - if it is not the specified player's turn.

    • sendChatMessage

      void sendChatMessage(ChatMessage message)
      Sends a chat message.

      This method sends a chat message to the server that then delivers it to the players contained in receiver. The message is represented by a ChatMessage object.

      Parameters:
      message - the ChatMessage object representing the chat message to be sent.

    • receiveMessage

      void receiveMessage(Message message)
      Delivers a received message to the clientModel.

      This method processes a received message represented by a Message object. It handles the necessary actions based on the content of the message.

      Parameters:
      message - the Message object representing the received message.

    • setClientModel

      void setClientModel(GameClientModel clientModel)

    • playerDisconnected

      void playerDisconnected()
      Handles a player disconnection.

      This method attempts to notify the server about a player disconnection via the stub. If a RemoteException occurs, it handles the server being down by calling serverDown(). Regardless of the exception, it updates the client model to indicate that the game has been aborted due to disconnection.

    • checkServerStatus

      void checkServerStatus()
      Checks the connectivity status with the server periodically.

      This method is used to check if the remote connection is still active.

    • serverDown

      void serverDown()
      Updates the client model to indicate that the server is down.

      This method sets the server status to down in the client model, allowing the client application to handle the server down scenario appropriately.

    • updateDisconnection

      void updateDisconnection()
      Updates the client model to indicate that the game has been aborted due to disconnection of another player.

      This method sets the game aborted status to true in the client model, allowing the client application to handle the disconnection scenario appropriately.

    • getClientModel

      GameClientModel getClientModel()
